In the past few years, the city centre has also witnessed major road reconstruction, as well as the renovation of the Republic square, funded by the American-Armenian billionaire [Kirk Kerkorian](/wiki/Kirk_Kerkorian "Kirk Kerkorian"). On the other hand, the Argentina-based Armenian businessman [Eduardo Eurnekian](/wiki/Eduardo_Eurnekian "Eduardo Eurnekian") took over the airport, while the cascade development project was funded by the US based Armenian millionaire [Gerard L. Cafesjian](/wiki/Gerard_L._Cafesjian "Gerard L. Cafesjian").

However, the sector has significantly dropped by the end of the 1st decade of the 21st century, as a result of the [global real estate crisis](/wiki/Real_estate_bubble "Real estate bubble") in 2007--09. In 2013, Yerevan dominated over 58% of the annual total construction sector of Armenia.^\[*[citation needed](/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed "Wikipedia:Citation needed")*\]^

In February 2017, the urban development committee of the government revealed its plans for the upcoming major construction projects in the city. With a total cost of US$300 million, a new business district will rise at the centre of the city, to replace the current Firdowsi shopping area.^[\[182\]](#cite_note-187)^ The committee has also announced the construction of *Noy* (Noah) ethnographic residential district at the western vicinity of Kentron District, with an approximate cost of US$100 million.^[\[183\]](#cite_note-188)^{#cite_ref-188}  

### Energy {#Energy}

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c5/%D0%9A%D0%B0%D0%BD%D0%B0%D0%BA%D0%B5%D1%80.jpg/220px-%D0%9A%D0%B0%D0%BD%D0%B0%D0%BA%D0%B5%D1%80.jpg)](/wiki/File:%D0%9A%D0%B0%D0%BD%D0%B0%D0%BA%D0%B5%D1%80.jpg) Kanaker HPP of Yerevan

The location of the city on the shores of Hrazdan river has enabled the production of hydroelectricity. As part of the [Sevan--Hrazdan Cascade](/wiki/Sevan%E2%80%93Hrazdan_Cascade "Sevan–Hrazdan Cascade"), three [hydroelectric power plants](/wiki/Hydroelectric_power_plant "Hydroelectric power plant") are established within the administrative territory of Yerevan: Kanaker HPP,^[\[184\]](#cite_note-189)^ Yerevan-1 HPP,^[\[185\]](#cite_note-190)^ and Yerevan-3 HPP.^[\[186\]](#cite_note-191)^ The entire plant was privatized in 2003, and is currently owned by [RusHydro](/wiki/RusHydro "RusHydro").^[\[187\]](#cite_note-192)^^[\[188\]](#cite_note-193)^{#cite_ref-193}

The city is also home to the [Yerevan Thermal Power Plant](/wiki/Yerevan_Thermal_Power_Plant "Yerevan Thermal Power Plant"), a unique facility in the region for its quality and high technology, situated in the southern part of the city. Originally opened in 1961, a modern plant was built in 2007, furnished with a new gas-steam combined cycled turbine, to generate electric power.^[\[189\]](#cite_note-194)^^[\[190\]](#cite_note-195)^ In March 2017, the construction of a new thermal power plant was launched with an initial investment of US$258 million and an envisaged capacity of 250 megawatts. The power station will be in service in 2019.^[\[191\]](#cite_note-196)^{#cite_ref-196}  

### Tourism and nightlife {#Tourism_and_nightlife}

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/00/Yerevan_hotel%2C_Yerevan_02.jpg/220px-Yerevan_hotel%2C_Yerevan_02.jpg)](/wiki/File:Yerevan_hotel,_Yerevan_02.jpg) Grand Hotel Yerevan operating since 1926 [![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/10/2014_Erywa%C5%84%2C_Hotel_Armenia_Marriot_%2802%29.jpg/220px-2014_Erywa%C5%84%2C_Hotel_Armenia_Marriot_%2802%29.jpg)](/wiki/File:2014_Erywa%C5%84,_Hotel_Armenia_Marriot_(02).jpg) Armenia Marriott Hotel Yerevan at the Republic Square, built in 1958 with traditional Armenian arch series at the façade

[Tourism in Armenia](/wiki/Tourism_in_Armenia "Tourism in Armenia") is developing year by year and the capital city of Yerevan is one of the major tourist destinations.^[\[192\]](#cite_note-FMPRCGOVCN-197)^ The city has a majority of luxury hotels, modern restaurants, bars, pubs and nightclubs. Zvartnots airport has also conducted renovation projects with the growing number of tourists visiting the country. Numerous places in Yerevan are attractive for tourists, such as the dancing fountains of the Republic Square, the State Opera House, the [Cascade complex](/wiki/Yerevan_Cascade "Yerevan Cascade"), the ruins of the [Urartian](/wiki/Urartu "Urartu") city of Erebuni (Arin Berd), the historical site of Karmir Blur ([Teishebaini](/wiki/Teishebaini "Teishebaini")), etc. The largest hotel of the city is the [Ani Plaza Hotel](/wiki/Ani_Plaza_Hotel "Ani Plaza Hotel"). The [Armenia Marriott Hotel](/wiki/Armenia_Marriott_Hotel_Yerevan "Armenia Marriott Hotel Yerevan") is located at the Republic Square at the centre of Yerevan, while the [Radisson Blu Hotel](/wiki/Radisson_Blu_Hotel,_Yerevan "Radisson Blu Hotel, Yerevan") is located near the [Victory Park](/wiki/Victory_Park,_Yerevan "Victory Park, Yerevan"). Other major chains operating in central Yerevan include the [Grand Hotel Yerevan](/wiki/Grand_Hotel_Yerevan "Grand Hotel Yerevan") of the *Small Luxury Hotels of the World* ,^[\[193\]](#cite_note-198)^ the [Best Western](/wiki/Best_Western "Best Western") Congress Hotel, the [DoubleTree](/wiki/DoubleTree "DoubleTree") by Hilton, the [Hyatt](/wiki/Hyatt "Hyatt") Place, the [Ibis](/wiki/Ibis_(hotel) "Ibis (hotel)") Yerevan Center, and The Alexander, a Luxury Collection Hotel of [Marriott International](/wiki/Marriott_International "Marriott International").^[\[194\]](#cite_note-199)^{#cite_ref-199}
[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/02/Armenia_-_Cafe_Society%2C_Yerevan_%285034085783%29.jpg/220px-Armenia_-_Cafe_Society%2C_Yerevan_%285034085783%29.jpg)](/wiki/File:Armenia_-_Cafe_Society,_Yerevan_(5034085783).jpg) Crowded cafés near the Yerevan Opera House

The location of Yerevan itself, is an inspiring factor for the foreigners to visit the city in order to enjoy the view of the biblical mount of [Ararat](/wiki/Mount_Ararat "Mount Ararat"), as the city lies on the feet of the mountain forming the shape of a Roman [amphitheatre](/wiki/Amphitheatre "Amphitheatre").

There are many historical sites, churches and citadels in areas and regions surrounding the city of Yerevan, such as [Garni Temple](/wiki/Garni_Temple "Garni Temple"), [Zvartnots Cathedral](/wiki/Zvartnots_Cathedral "Zvartnots Cathedral"), the monasteries of [Khor Virap](/wiki/Khor_Virap "Khor Virap") and [Geghard](/wiki/Geghard "Geghard"), etc.

Being among the top 10 safest cities in the world, Yerevan has an extensive nightlife scene with a variety of [nightclubs](/wiki/Nightclub "Nightclub"),^[\[195\]](#cite_note-200)^ live venues, pedestrian zones, street cafés, jazz cafés, tea houses, [casinos](/wiki/Casino "Casino"), pubs, [karaoke](/wiki/Karaoke "Karaoke") clubs and restaurants. Casino Shangri La and Pharaon Complex are among the largest leisure and entertainment centres of the city.{#cite_ref-200}

Many world-famous music stars, Russian music celebrities, as well as Armenian singers from diaspora, occasionally perform in concerts in Yerevan.

The [Yerevan Zoo](/wiki/Yerevan_Zoo "Yerevan Zoo") founded in 1940, the [Yerevan Circus](/wiki/Yerevan_Circus "Yerevan Circus") opened in 1956, and the [Yerevan Water World](/wiki/Yerevan_Water_World "Yerevan Water World") opened in 2001, are among the popular entertaining centres in the city.
[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/07/Dalma_Garden_Mall.jpg/220px-Dalma_Garden_Mall.jpg)](/wiki/File:Dalma_Garden_Mall.jpg) Dalma Garden Mall

The [Northern Avenue](/wiki/Northern_Avenue_(Yerevan) "Northern Avenue (Yerevan)") that connects the Opera House with Abovyan street is a popular pedestrian zone in Yerevan with modern residential buildings, business centres, restaurants, bars and cafés. Another popular landmarks is the [Yerevan Cascade](/wiki/Yerevan_Cascade "Yerevan Cascade") and the "Cafesjian Sculpture Garden" on [Tamanyan Street](/wiki/Tamanyan_Street "Tamanyan Street") with its pedestrian zone, featuring many coffee shops, bars, restaurants, and pubs at the sidewalks. The "Cafesjian Center for the Arts" regularly organizes art events throughout the year, including classical music series, traditional folk dance events, and live concerts of jazz, pop and rock music.^[\[196\]](#cite_note-201)^{#cite_ref-201}

As of 2017, Yerevan has three shopping malls: [Dalma Garden Mall](/wiki/Dalma_Garden_Mall "Dalma Garden Mall") opened in October 2012, followed by [Yerevan Mall](/wiki/Yerevan_Mall "Yerevan Mall") in February 2014, and [Rossia Mall](/wiki/Rossia_Mall "Rossia Mall") in March 2016.

International study conducted by Mercer and published in 2019 identified Yerevan to offer higher quality of living, than other capital cities of Transcaucasia.^[\[197\]](#cite_note-202)^^[\[198\]](#cite_note-203)^{#cite_ref-203}  

Education {#Education}
----------------------

See also: [List of universities in Yerevan](/wiki/List_of_universities_in_Yerevan "List of universities in Yerevan")
[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0f/Yerevan_State_University.jpg/220px-Yerevan_State_University.jpg)](/wiki/File:Yerevan_State_University.jpg) Yerevan State University

Yerevan is a major educational centre in the region. As of 2017^[\[update\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Yerevan&action=edit)^, the city is home to more than 250 schools, of which about 210 are state-owned, with 3/4 of them run by the municipality and the rest run by the ministry of education. The rest of the schools (about 40) are privately owned. The municipality also runs 160 kindergartens throughout the city.^[\[199\]](#cite_note-204)^{#cite_ref-204}

The [QSI International School](/wiki/QSI_International_School_of_Yerevan "QSI International School of Yerevan"), [École Française Internationale en Arménie](/wiki/%C3%89cole_Fran%C3%A7aise_Internationale_en_Arm%C3%A9nie "École Française Internationale en Arménie"), [Ayb School](/wiki/Ayb_School "Ayb School"), [Mkhitar Sebastatsi Educational Complex](/wiki/Mkhitar_Sebastatsi_Educational_Complex "Mkhitar Sebastatsi Educational Complex") and [Khoren and Shooshanig Avedisian School](/wiki/Khoren_and_Shooshanig_Avedisian_School "Khoren and Shooshanig Avedisian School") are among the prominent international or private schools in Yerevan.

As of 2018^[\[update\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Yerevan&action=edit)^, around 60 [higher education](/wiki/Higher_education "Higher education") institutions are accredited and licensed to operate in the Republic of Armenia. Yerevan is home to about 50 universities, nearly half of which are public. [Yerevan State University](/wiki/Yerevan_State_University "Yerevan State University"), [American University of Armenia](/wiki/American_University_of_Armenia "American University of Armenia"), [Russian-Armenian (Slavonic) University](/wiki/Russian-Armenian_(Slavonic)_University "Russian-Armenian (Slavonic) University"), [Yerevan State Medical University](/wiki/Yerevan_State_Medical_University "Yerevan State Medical University") and [Armenian State Pedagogical University](/wiki/Armenian_State_Pedagogical_University "Armenian State Pedagogical University") are the top rated universities of Armenia and among the top rated in the region.^[\[200\]](#cite_note-205)^{#cite_ref-205}  

### Science and research {#Science_and_research}

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f3/Tumo_Center_for_Creative_Technologies.jpg/220px-Tumo_Center_for_Creative_Technologies.jpg)](/wiki/File:Tumo_Center_for_Creative_Technologies.jpg) Tumo Center for Creative Technologies

Under the Soviet rule, Yerevan has turned into a major centre for science and research. The [Armenian National Academy of Sciences](/wiki/Armenian_National_Academy_of_Sciences "Armenian National Academy of Sciences") is the pioneer of scientific research in Armenia. It was founded in 1943 as the Armenian Branch of the [Soviet Academy of Sciences](/wiki/Russian_Academy_of_Sciences "Russian Academy of Sciences") to become the primary body that conducts research and coordinates activities in the fields of science in Armenia. It has many divisions, including Mathematical and Technical Sciences, Physics and Astrophysics, Natural Sciences, Chemistry and Earth Sciences, Armenology and Social Sciences.^[\[201\]](#cite_note-206)^{#cite_ref-206}

After the independence, many new research centres were opened in the city, such as the [CANDLE Synchrotron Research Institute](/wiki/CANDLE_Synchrotron_Research_Institute "CANDLE Synchrotron Research Institute") (2010),^[\[202\]](#cite_note-207)^ [Tumo Center for Creative Technologies](/wiki/Tumo_Center_for_Creative_Technologies "Tumo Center for Creative Technologies") (2011),^[\[203\]](#cite_note-208)^ and [Nerses Mets Medical Research and Education Center](/wiki/Izmirlian_Medical_Center "Izmirlian Medical Center") (2013).^[\[204\]](#cite_note-209)^{#cite_ref-209}

After the Russian invasion of Ukraine in March 2022, over 40,000 Russian professionals and programmers arrived in Yerevan. Half stayed briefly and then moved on while the rest reestablished themselves using internet connections that kept Armenia connected to the world while Russia was increasingly cut off. In addition to IT experts the exodus included many bloggers, journalists and activists who faced arrest for criticizing the war in Ukraine. Interviews indicated that none of the exiles encountered hostility in Yerevan. They can enter Armenia without visas or passports and remain six months; Russian is widely spoken.^[\[205\]](#cite_note-210)^{#cite_ref-210}  

Sport {#Sport}
--------------

See also: [List of sports venues in Yerevan](/wiki/List_of_sports_venues_in_Yerevan "List of sports venues in Yerevan")  

### Football {#Football}

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e8/Hrazdan_Stadium_2013%2C_Yerevan.jpg/220px-Hrazdan_Stadium_2013%2C_Yerevan.jpg)](/wiki/File:Hrazdan_Stadium_2013,_Yerevan.jpg) Hrazdan Stadium [![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1c/Hanrapetakan_stadium.jpg/220px-Hanrapetakan_stadium.jpg)](/wiki/File:Hanrapetakan_stadium.jpg) Vazgen Sargsyan Republican Stadium

[Football](/wiki/Association_football "Association football") is the most played and popular sport in Yerevan and the entire country. Yerevan city is home to about a dozen of [football clubs](/wiki/Category:Football_clubs_in_Armenia "Category:Football clubs in Armenia") competing in the [Armenian Premier League](/wiki/Armenian_Premier_League "Armenian Premier League") and the [Armenian First League](/wiki/Armenian_First_League "Armenian First League"), with the most successful clubs being [Pyunik](/wiki/FC_Pyunik "FC Pyunik"), [Alashkert](/wiki/FC_Alashkert "FC Alashkert"), [Ararat Yerevan](/wiki/FC_Ararat_Yerevan "FC Ararat Yerevan"), [Ararat-Armenia](/wiki/FC_Ararat-Armenia "FC Ararat-Armenia"), [Urartu](/wiki/FC_Urartu "FC Urartu") and [Yerevan](/wiki/FC_Yerevan "FC Yerevan").^[\[206\]](#cite_note-Football_clubs-211)^{#cite_ref-Football_clubs_211-0}

[Hrazdan Stadium](/wiki/Hrazdan_Stadium "Hrazdan Stadium") in Yerevan is the largest sports venue of Armenia. The 2nd-largest stadium in the city is the [Vazgen Sargsyan Republican Stadium](/wiki/Vazgen_Sargsyan_Republican_Stadium "Vazgen Sargsyan Republican Stadium") which currently serves as the primary home ground of the [Armenia national football team](/wiki/Armenia_national_football_team "Armenia national football team").^[\[207\]](#cite_note-212)^{#cite_ref-212}

The [Football Academy of Yerevan](/wiki/Yerevan_Football_Academy "Yerevan Football Academy") operated by the [Football Federation of Armenia](/wiki/Football_Federation_of_Armenia "Football Federation of Armenia") is an up-to-date training academy complex, opened in 2010.^[\[208\]](#cite_note-213)^{#cite_ref-213}

As of 2017, there are around 130 mini-football pitches among the courtyards of the Yerevan neighborhoods, built by the municipal authorities.^[\[209\]](#cite_note-214)^{#cite_ref-214}  

### Chess {#Chess}

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b3/%D5%84%D5%B7%D5%A1%D5%AF%D5%B8%D6%82%D5%B5%D5%A9%D5%AB_%D5%BF%D5%B8%D6%82%D5%B6._%D5%8F%D5%AB%D5%A3%D6%80%D5%A1%D5%B6_%D5%8A%D5%A5%D5%BF%D6%80%D5%B8%D5%BD%D5%B5%D5%A1%D5%B6%D5%AB_%D5%A1%D5%B6%D5%BE%D5%A1%D5%B6_%D5%87%D5%A1%D5%AD%D5%B4%D5%A1%D5%BF%D5%AB%D5%BD%D5%BF%D5%AB_%D5%AF%D5%A5%D5%B6%D5%BF%D6%80%D5%B8%D5%B6%D5%A1%D5%AF%D5%A1%D5%B6_%D5%BF%D5%B8%D6%82%D5%B6%D5%A8_%281%29.JPG/220px-%D5%84%D5%B7%D5%A1%D5%AF%D5%B8%D6%82%D5%B5%D5%A9%D5%AB_%D5%BF%D5%B8%D6%82%D5%B6._%D5%8F%D5%AB%D5%A3%D6%80%D5%A1%D5%B6_%D5%8A%D5%A5%D5%BF%D6%80%D5%B8%D5%BD%D5%B5%D5%A1%D5%B6%D5%AB_%D5%A1%D5%B6%D5%BE%D5%A1%D5%B6_%D5%87%D5%A1%D5%AD%D5%B4%D5%A1%D5%BF%D5%AB%D5%BD%D5%BF%D5%AB_%D5%AF%D5%A5%D5%B6%D5%BF%D6%80%D5%B8%D5%B6%D5%A1%D5%AF%D5%A1%D5%B6_%D5%BF%D5%B8%D6%82%D5%B6%D5%A8_%281%29.JPG)](/wiki/File:%D5%84%D5%B7%D5%A1%D5%AF%D5%B8%D6%82%D5%B5%D5%A9%D5%AB_%D5%BF%D5%B8%D6%82%D5%B6._%D5%8F%D5%AB%D5%A3%D6%80%D5%A1%D5%B6_%D5%8A%D5%A5%D5%BF%D6%80%D5%B8%D5%BD%D5%B5%D5%A1%D5%B6%D5%AB_%D5%A1%D5%B6%D5%BE%D5%A1%D5%B6_%D5%87%D5%A1%D5%AD%D5%B4%D5%A1%D5%BF%D5%AB%D5%BD%D5%BF%D5%AB_%D5%AF%D5%A5%D5%B6%D5%BF%D6%80%D5%B8%D5%B6%D5%A1%D5%AF%D5%A1%D5%B6_%D5%BF%D5%B8%D6%82%D5%B6%D5%A8_(1).JPG) Tigran Petrosian Chess House

Armenia has always excelled in [chess](/wiki/Chess "Chess") with its players being very often among the highest ranked and decorated. The headquarters of the [Chess Federation of Armenia](/wiki/Chess_Federation_of_Armenia "Chess Federation of Armenia") is located in the [Tigran Petrosian Chess House](/wiki/Tigran_Petrosian_Chess_House "Tigran Petrosian Chess House") of Yerevan.^[\[210\]](#cite_note-215)^ Already in primary school, chess education is offered. The city is home to a large number of chess teams and training schools. In 1996, despite the severe economic conditions in the country, Yerevan hosted the [32nd Chess Olympiad](/wiki/32nd_Chess_Olympiad "32nd Chess Olympiad").^[\[211\]](#cite_note-216)^ In 2006, the four members from Yerevan of the Armenian chess team won the [37th Chess Olympiad](/wiki/37th_Chess_Olympiad "37th Chess Olympiad") in [Turin](/wiki/Turin "Turin") and repeated the feat at the [38th Chess Olympiad](/wiki/38th_Chess_Olympiad "38th Chess Olympiad") in [Dresden](/wiki/Dresden "Dresden"). Armenian won the chess Olympiad for the 3rd time in [2012](/wiki/40th_Chess_Olympiad "40th Chess Olympiad") in [Istanbul](/wiki/Istanbul "Istanbul"). The Yerevan-born leader of the chess national team; [Levon Aronian](/wiki/Levon_Aronian "Levon Aronian"), is one of the top chess players in the world.{#cite_ref-216}  

### Basketball {#Basketball}

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/93/Mika_Arena%2C_Yerevan.jpg/220px-Mika_Arena%2C_Yerevan.jpg)](/wiki/File:Mika_Arena,_Yerevan.jpg) [Armenia national basketball team](/wiki/Armenia_men%27s_national_basketball_team "Armenia men's national basketball team") at the [Mika Arena](/wiki/Mika_Sports_Arena "Mika Sports Arena")

The [first ever season](/wiki/2017%E2%80%9318_Armenia_Basketball_League_A "2017–18 Armenia Basketball League A") of the professional domestic basketball competition of Armenia, known as [Armenia Basketball League A](/wiki/Armenia_Basketball_League_A "Armenia Basketball League A"), was launched in October 2017 with 7 participating teams. Yerevan is represented by 4 clubs: Engineer Yerevan, [FIMA Basketball](/wiki/FIMA_Basketball "FIMA Basketball"), [BC Grand Sport](/wiki/BC_Grand_Sport "BC Grand Sport") and [BC Urartu](/wiki/BC_Urartu "BC Urartu").^[\[212\]](#cite_note-217)^{#cite_ref-217}  

### Tennis {#Tennis}

[Tennis](/wiki/Tennis "Tennis") is also among the popular sports in Yerevan. Several tennis clubs operate in the city, with many of them founded during the Soviet days. Incourt Tennis Club --founded in 1974-- is the largest in the city, with many indoor and outdoor courts.^[\[213\]](#cite_note-218)^ Ararat Tennis Club founded in 1990, is also among the prominent clubs in the city.^[\[214\]](#cite_note-219)^ Tennis clubs are also found within the Yerevan State Sports College of Olympic Reserve since 1971, and the Yerevan Football Academy since 2010.{#cite_ref-219}

[Sargis Sargsian](/wiki/Sargis_Sargsian "Sargis Sargsian") and [Ani Amiraghyan](/wiki/Ani_Amiraghyan "Ani Amiraghyan") are the most successful tennis players of Armenia and are from Yerevan.  

### Artistic gymnastics {#Artistic_gymnastics}

Armenia has produced many Olympic champions in [artistic gymnastics](/wiki/Artistic_gymnastics "Artistic gymnastics") during the Soviet days, such as [Hrant Shahinyan](/wiki/Hrant_Shahinyan "Hrant Shahinyan"), [Albert Azaryan](/wiki/Albert_Azaryan "Albert Azaryan") and [Eduard Azaryan](/wiki/Eduard_Azaryan "Eduard Azaryan"). The success of the Armenian gymnasts in the Olympic competitions has greatly contributed in the popularity of the sport. Thus, many prominent competitors represent the country in the European and World championships, including [Artur Davtyan](/wiki/Artur_Davtyan "Artur Davtyan") and [Harutyun Merdinyan](/wiki/Harutyun_Merdinyan "Harutyun Merdinyan").

Yerevan has many state-owned schools of artistic gymnastics, including the Albert Azaryan School opened in 1964 and the Hrant Shahinyan School opened in 1965.  

### Other sports {#Other_sports}

[Karen Demirchyan Sports and Concerts Complex](/wiki/Karen_Demirchyan_Complex "Karen Demirchyan Complex")^[\[215\]](#cite_note-220)^ is the largest indoor arena in the city and the entire country. It is mostly used for indoor sport events, including [ice hockey](/wiki/Ice_hockey "Ice hockey") and [figure skating](/wiki/Figure_skating "Figure skating") shows. On the other hand, Dinamo and Mika indoor arenas are the regular venues for domestic and regional competitions of [basketball](/wiki/Basketball "Basketball"), [volleyball](/wiki/Volleyball "Volleyball"), [handball](/wiki/Handball "Handball") and [futsal](/wiki/Futsal "Futsal").^[\[216\]](#cite_note-arka-221)^{#cite_ref-arka_221-0}

[Armenia Sports Union](/wiki/Armenia_Sports_Union "Armenia Sports Union") (*Spartak Sports Union* between 1935 and 1999) is a sports society mainly involved in individual Olympic sports, including [boxing](/wiki/Boxing "Boxing"), [weightlifting](/wiki/Olympic_weightlifting "Olympic weightlifting"), [athletics](/wiki/Sport_of_athletics "Sport of athletics"), [wrestling](/wiki/Wrestling "Wrestling"), [taekwondo](/wiki/Taekwondo "Taekwondo"), [table tennis](/wiki/Table_tennis "Table tennis"), etc.^[\[217\]](#cite_note-222)^{#cite_ref-222}

The "Yerevan State Sports College of Olympic Reserve" is a large sports and educational complex located in the Malatia-Sebastia District of the city. It was founded in 1971, and is home to individual as well as team sport schools, such as wrestling, boxing, weightlifting, [judo](/wiki/Judo "Judo"), athletics, [acrobatic gymnastics](/wiki/Acrobatic_gymnastics "Acrobatic gymnastics"), [artistic gymnastics](/wiki/Artistic_gymnastics "Artistic gymnastics"), [swimming](/wiki/Swimming_(sport) "Swimming (sport)"), table tennis, cycling, basketball, volleyball and handball.^[\[218\]](#cite_note-223)^{#cite_ref-223}

In September 2015, the new Olympic Training Complex of Yerevan, locally known as *Olympavan* , was opened in Davtashen District. It is a state of the art sports complex, with training facilities for most Olympic individual and team sports, as well as water sports. It is also home to the anti-doping medical centre and a hotel designated to accommodate more than 300 athletes.^[\[219\]](#cite_note-224)^{#cite_ref-224}
[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ee/Olympavan_%281%29.jpg/220px-Olympavan_%281%29.jpg)](/wiki/File:Olympavan_(1).jpg) *Olympavan* , home and training complex of the [Armenian Olympic Committee](/wiki/Armenian_Olympic_Committee "Armenian Olympic Committee")

[Equestrian sport](/wiki/Equestrianism "Equestrianism") was introduced to Armenia in 1953. The [Hovik Hayrapetyan Equestrian Centre](/wiki/Hovik_Hayrapetyan_Equestrian_Centre "Hovik Hayrapetyan Equestrian Centre") opened in 2001, occupies an area of 85 hectares at the southern Shengavit District of Yerevan. It is the centre of equestrian sport and [horse racing](/wiki/Horse_racing "Horse racing") in Armenia.^[\[220\]](#cite_note-225)^{#cite_ref-225}

[Golf](/wiki/Golf "Golf") has been introduced to the citizens of Yerevan in 1999, with the foundation of the Ararat Valley Country Club in the Vahakni neighbourhood of Ajapnyak District. It is the first-ever [golf course](/wiki/Golf_course "Golf course") opened in Armenia as well as the Transcaucasian region.^[\[221\]](#cite_note-226)^{#cite_ref-226}

Arena Bowling and Billiards Club is an up-to-date sports and leisure centre opened in 2004 and located on [Mashtots Avenue](/wiki/Mashtots_Avenue "Mashtots Avenue") in central Yerevan.^[\[222\]](#cite_note-227)^{#cite_ref-227}

[Cycling](/wiki/Cycle_sport "Cycle sport") as a sport is becoming popular among the young generation. The [Yerevan Velodrome](/wiki/Yerevan_Velodrome "Yerevan Velodrome") is an outdoor [track cycling](/wiki/Track_cycling "Track cycling") venue with international standard, opened in 2011 to replace the old venue of the Soviet days.^[\[223\]](#cite_note-228)^ Edgar Stepanyan of Armenia became champion of the [scratch race](/wiki/Scratch_race "Scratch race") in the [2015 junior UEC European Track Championships](/wiki/2015_UEC_European_Track_Championships_(under-23_%26_junior) "2015 UEC European Track Championships (under-23 & junior)").^[\[224\]](#cite_note-229)^{#cite_ref-229}

In an attempt to promote [figure skating](/wiki/Figure_skating "Figure skating") and [ice hockey](/wiki/Ice_hockey "Ice hockey") in Armenia, the [Irina Rodnina Figure Skating Centre](/wiki/Irina_Rodnina_Figure_Skating_Centre "Irina Rodnina Figure Skating Centre") was opened in Yerevan, in December 2015.^[\[225\]](#cite_note-230)^{#cite_ref-230}

[Futsal](/wiki/Futsal "Futsal") is also among the popular sports in Armenia. Many companies as well as universities have their own teams who participate in the [Armenian Futsal Premier League](/wiki/Armenian_Futsal_Premier_League "Armenian Futsal Premier League"). Currently, *[Futsal Club Leo](/wiki/Futsal_Club_Leo "Futsal Club Leo")* based in Yerevan, is considered as the most successful team in the [Armenian Futsal Premier League](/wiki/Armenian_Futsal_Premier_League "Armenian Futsal Premier League").^[\[206\]](#cite_note-Football_clubs-211)^{#cite_ref-Football_clubs_211-1}

Recently, [MMA](/wiki/Mixed_martial_arts "Mixed martial arts") has gained massive popularity in Armenia, being promoted by *Armfighting* Professional Federation based in Yerevan. It was founded in 2005 by *Hayk Ghukasyan* and currently runs several branches throughout the provinces of Armenia and [Artsakh](/wiki/Nagorno-Karabakh_Republic "Nagorno-Karabakh Republic") with more than 2,000 athletes.^[\[226\]](#cite_note-231)^{#cite_ref-231}

With the increased interest in healthy lifestyle and fitness, many large and modern training complexes with indoor and outdoor swimming pools have recently been opened in the city such as the Davit Hambardzumyan Swimming and Diving Olympic School, Orange Fitness Premium Club, DDD Sports Complex, Aqua Land Sports Complex, [Gold's Gym](/wiki/Gold%27s_Gym "Gold's Gym"), Grand Sport Complex, [Reebok](/wiki/Reebok "Reebok") Sports Club, and Multi Wellness Sport and Health Center.  

International relations {#International_relations}
--------------------------------------------------

The city of Yerevan is member of many international organizations: the International Assembly of CIS Countries' Capitals and Big Cities (MAG), the Black Sea Capitals' Association (BSCA), the International Association of Francophone Mayors (AIMF),^[\[227\]](#cite_note-232)^ the [Organization of World Heritage Cities](/wiki/Organization_of_World_Heritage_Cities "Organization of World Heritage Cities") (OWHC), the International Association of Large-scale Communities, and the International Urban Community Lighting Association (LUCI).{#cite_ref-232}

Notes {#Notes}

1. **[\^](#cite_ref-7)** [Armenian](/wiki/Armenian_language "Armenian language"): վարդագույն քաղաք, [romanized](/wiki/Romanization_of_Armenian "Romanization of Armenian"): *vardaguyn k'aghak'*, [lit.](/wiki/Literal_translation "Literal translation") '[rosy](/wiki/Rose_(color) "Rose (color)") city'.^[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)^^[\[6\]](#cite_note-6)^{#cite_ref-6}
{#cite_note-7}
2. **[\^](#cite_ref-12)** Literal translation of the Armenian word for 'capital' (մայրաքաղաք, *mayrak'aghak'*, or քաղաքամայր, *k'aghak'amayr*).^[\[9\]](#cite_note-10)^^[\[10\]](#cite_note-11)^{#cite_ref-11}
{#cite_note-12}
3. **[\^](#cite_ref-28)** [Classical spelling](/wiki/Classical_Armenian_orthography "Classical Armenian orthography"): Երեւան; spelled Յերեվան between 1922 and 1940.^[\[25\]](#cite_note-27)^{#cite_ref-27}
{#cite_note-28}
4. **[\^](#cite_ref-31)** From the occasional local pronunciation [\[ɛɾɛˈvɑn\]](/wiki/Help:IPA/Armenian "Help:IPA/Armenian"), which is phonetically spelled Էրևան, *Ērevan*.^[\[26\]](#cite_note-29)^^[\[27\]](#cite_note-30)^{#cite_ref-30}
{#cite_note-31}
5. **[\^](#cite_ref-125)** Also appears as 29,766 in the list of populated places in the Caucasus on page 213 of the 1915 publication of the *Caucasian Calendar*.{#cite_note-125}
{#cite_note-125}
